Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Homelessne.Homelessness_with_annotation: The floods forced families to evacuate in low-lying areas of northern Louisiana.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Injury.Injury_with_annotation: Five people required rescue after being trapped in a fast-moving river.

Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: The 1933 Texas tropical storm produced record rainfall in the south-central United States in July of the 1933 Atlantic hurricane season. It was the third storm of the season, developing on July 14 near the Lesser Antilles.

Total_Summary_Insured_Damage.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: High rains left about $1.5 million in crop damage between two Texas counties.

Total_Insured_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: High rains left about $1.5 million in crop damage between two Texas counties.
The storm washed out roads, most of them unpaved, and one bridge was wrecked; this disrupted the regional transportation.
It later moved across Belize and the Yucatán Peninsula, although no stations reported gale-force winds or low pressures.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Insured_Da.Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_annotatio: High rains left about $1.5 million in crop damage between two Texas counties.
Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
The rainfall in Shreveport caused the worst floods related to a tropical cyclone on record.
Both Kingston and Saint Andrew Parish reported 9 in (230 mm), causing flooding and landslides.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: The floods forced families to evacuate in low-lying areas of northern Louisiana.

Location_with_Annotation.Jamaica: While passing south of Jamaica, the storm produced the heavy rainfall in the month of July in at least 40 years, which overflowed rivers.
Location_with_Annotation.Belize: Around 1500 UTC on July 18, the storm made landfall near Belize City, British Honduras, at its peak intensity.
Location_with_Annotation.Yucatan Peninsula: After moving ashore, the storm quickly weakened into a tropical depression while crossing the Yucatán Peninsula.
Location_with_Annotation.Southeastern Texas: At around 0800 UTC on July 23, the storm moved ashore on Matagorda Bay in southeastern Texas with winds of about 45 mph (75 km/h).
Location_with_Annotation.Eastern Texas: Turning eastward, the storm dropped torrential rainfall in eastern Texas and western Louisiana, peaking at 21.3 in (540 mm) in Logansport, Louisiana.
Location_with_Annotation.Western Louisiana: Turning eastward, the storm dropped torrential rainfall in eastern Texas and western Louisiana, peaking at 21.3 in (540 mm) in Logansport, Louisiana.
Location_with_Annotation.Shreveport, Louisiana: Logansport also reported a 24‑hour total of 18 in (460 mm), which set the record for the highest daily rainfall total there in July. A secondary rainfall maxima of 19.4 in (490 mm) was observed in Shreveport.
Location_with_Annotation.Logansport, Louisiana: The highest rainfall total was 21.3 in (540 mm) in Logansport, Louisiana.
Location_with_Annotation.Alexandria, Louisiana: Alexandria also broke its 24‑hour rainfall record in July with a total of 9.75 in (248 mm) on July 25.
Location_with_Annotation.Southern Arkansas: Heavy rains spread into southern Arkansas and northwestern Mississippi.
Location_with_Annotation.Northwestern Mississippi: Heavy rains spread into southern Arkansas and northwestern Mississippi.
Location_with_Annotation.Shelby County, Texas: High rains in eastern Texas, totaling over 10 in (250 mm), flooded roads in Shelby and Panola counties; damage in the two counties collectively totaled $1.5 million.
Location_with_Annotation.Panola County, Texas: High rains in eastern Texas, totaling over 10 in (250 mm), flooded roads in Shelby and Panola counties; damage in the two counties collectively totaled $1.5 million.
Location_with_Annotation.Henderson, Texas: Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
Location_with_Annotation.Carthage, Texas: Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
Location_with_Annotation.Longview, Texas: Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
Location_with_Annotation.Converse, Louisiana: The rains caused many streams to exceed their banks, including one creek near Converse that flooded roads and railways.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Building_D.Building_Damage_with_annotation: Both Kingston and Saint Andrew Parish reported 9 in (230 mm), causing flooding and landslides.
Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
A severe thunderstorm related to the storm damaged roofs and windows in Alexandria, Louisiana.

Total_Affected_Per_Country.Affected_with_annotation: While passing south of Jamaica, the storm produced the heavy rainfall in the month of July in at least 40 years, which overflowed rivers.
It later moved across Belize and the Yucatán Peninsula, although no stations reported gale-force winds or low pressures.
Despite being a weak tropical cyclone, the storm dropped heavy rainfall in eastern Texas and northwestern Louisiana.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Affected.Affected_with_annotation: Both Kingston and Saint Andrew Parish reported 9 in (230 mm), causing flooding and landslides.

Affected_with_annotation: The highest rainfall total was 21.3 in (540 mm) in Logansport, Louisiana.
Logansport also reported a 24‑hour total of 18 in (460 mm), which set the record for the highest daily rainfall total there in July.

A secondary rainfall maxima of 19.4 in (490 mm) was observed in Shreveport, of which 12.4 in (310 mm) of rain fell in 24 hours; this was the highest daily total on record for the site, and remains the highest as of 2008.
Alexandria also broke its 24‑hour rainfall record in July with a total of 9.75 in (248 mm) on July 25.
High rains in eastern Texas, totaling over 10 in (250 mm), flooded roads in Shelby and Panola counties; damage in the two counties collectively totaled $1.5 million.
Storm-related flooding washed out a bridge in Henderson and portions of the Santa Fe Railway line between Carthage and Longview.
The rains caused many streams to exceed their banks, including one creek near Converse that flooded roads and railways.
